subject: Re: [junit] Fixing ant xml output for 4.0 release

messageBody:
On Thu, 09 Feb 2006, Ben Maurer <bmaurer@...> wrote:

> Is it possible to get the ant xml output fixed for junit 4.0's
> release.

You should probably talk to dev@ant instead of this list since the
report is provided by the Ant and not the JUnit community. But
thinking about it a second time, we may need some help from the JUnit
people here.

> Right now, it outputs:
>
> <testcase classname="junit.framework.JUnit4TestCaseFacade"
> name="unknown" time="0.02"></testcase>

Looking through Ant's code this is (for each instance test of Test in
the TestSuite)

<testcase classname="test.getClass().getName()"
name="test.getName()[1]" ...>

So the question is whether Ant has any better option than
test.getName() - or whether tests wrapped via JUnit4TestAdapter could
return something more resonable than null in the getName method.

> (It'd also be nice sugar to remove the need for
>
> public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
> return new JUnit4TestAdapter(JUnitCoreTest.class);
> }
>
> but that's just extra sugar)

In order for this to happen Ant would need a different TestRunner (it
uses one of its own) and a way to plug in different runners at
runtime. This is not likely to happen soon, in particular it would
require a new release of Ant.

Stefan

Footnotes:
[1] or Test.name() which is used by Ant if the getName() method isn't
part of the Test interface.
